a_0.formal problem:
theorem binomial_coefficient:
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 8"
and h1 : "k = 4"
shows  "binomial n k = 70"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\dbinom{8}{4}$. The final Answer is 70
 ### Proof
 \begin{align} \dbinom{8}{4} &= \dfrac{8!}{4!4!} \\ &= \dfrac{8\times 7\times 6\times 5}{4\times 3\times 2\times 1} \\ &= \dfrac{8}{4\times 2\times 1}\times 7 \times \dfrac{6}{3} \times 5 \\ &= 1\times 7\times 2\times 5 \\
 &= \boxed{70}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem binomial_coefficient:
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 8"
and h1 : "k = 4"
shows  "binomial n k = 70"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the binomial coefficient of $n = 8$ and $k = 4$. The final answer is 70.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 8"
and h1 : "k = 4"
shows  "n choose k = 70"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\dbinom{8}{4}$. The final Answer is 70
 ### Proof
 \begin{align} \dbinom{8}{4} &= \dfrac{8!}{4!4!} \\ &= \dfrac{8\times 7\times 6\times 5}{4\times 3\times 2\times 1} \\ &= \dfrac{8}{4\times 2\times 1}\times 7 \times \dfrac{6}{3} \times 5 \\ &= 1\times 7\times 2\times 5 \\
 &= \boxed{70}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 8"
and h1 : "k = 4"
shows  "n choose k = 70"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Find the number of combinations when choosing 4 items from a set of 8 items. The final answer is 70.

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n k binomial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n k. binomial n k = fact n div (fact k * fact (n - k))"
shows  "binomial 8 4 = 70"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\dbinom{8}{4}$. The final Answer is 70
 ### Proof
 \begin{align} \dbinom{8}{4} &= \dfrac{8!}{4!4!} \\ &= \dfrac{8\times 7\times 6\times 5}{4\times 3\times 2\times 1} \\ &= \dfrac{8}{4\times 2\times 1}\times 7 \times \dfrac{6}{3} \times 5 \\ &= 1\times 7\times 2\times 5 \\
 &= \boxed{70}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes n k binomial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n k. binomial n k = fact n div (fact k * fact (n - k))"
shows  "binomial 8 4 = 70"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: Find the binomial coefficient for n = 8 and k = 4, given by the formula $\binom{n}{k}=\frac{n!}{k!(n-k)!}$. The final answer is 70.
